programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A sheriff's daughter runs off with her boyfriend (John Ericson), unaware he is a murderous bank robber.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Ben gives farmland on the Ponderosa to an outcast Indian (Ricardo Montalban) who saved his life; guest Madlyn Rhue.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: An outlaw joins the Cartwrights' cattle drive, knowing it will take him to the town where his father is sheriff.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Attacked by Shoshones while crossing a burial ground, Adam discovers that the "Indian" woman tending him is white.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Little Joe runs into romantic complications when he tries to teach a deaf girl (Stella Stevens) sign language; guest Albert Salmi.

programme.title: Forbidden Trails
programme.desc: Ex-convicts lure one of the Rough Riders (Buck Jones, Tim McCoy, Raymond Hatton) to a kerosene-soaked shack.

programme.title: The Gunman From Bodie
programme.desc: The Rough Riders (Buck Jones, Tim McCoy, Raymond Hatton) act like strangers to catch a crooked lawyer.

programme.title: Below the Border
programme.desc: The Rough Riders (Buck Jones, Tim McCoy, Raymond Hatton) pose as strangers and nab outlaws near the Mexican border.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Adam tells betrothed Hoss his intended is a compulsive gambler who caused her husband's death.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A Kentucky mountain clan swears revenge on Little Joe after he shoots a family member for arson.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Little Joe and Hoss are mistaken for gunmen while in a small Texas town; they find themselves in the middle of a dangerous feud between two families.

programme.title: 26 Men
programme.desc: Captain Rynning struggles to find enough men to capture a gang of escaped convicts after they escape from prison.

programme.title: 26 Men
programme.desc: When Clint Travis is falsely accused of a murder, Rynning sends him into Galioro Mountains to prove his innocence by finding the cattle rustlers who actually committed the crime.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Infamous outlaw Augustine Chacon murders two Texas Rangers, prompting Matt and Margaret to travel south of the border to bring him to justice.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Margaret follow the trail of Cherokee Bill after he kills a marshal riding a train and they find the outlaw hiding out in his mother's cabin.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Roy hires an ex-con who is quickly suspected of committing several recent robberies.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A woman from Connecticut arrives at Dale's cafe seeking her father.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A greedy veterinarian plans to murder a blind prospector who is using Roy's dog.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Roy and Pat aid a boxer (Charles Bronson) who has criminal connections.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Con men trick an unsuspecting Dale into selling the ranch.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A group of cattle rustlers tries to sell stolen beef to Dale's cafe.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A crook is mistakenly given cash designated for the construction of a clinic.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: The owner of a gun used to kill a rancher protests his innocence.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Roy and Dale discover the body of a murdered Indian chief.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: The Mingo Kid swaps clothes with Roy, who is then taken hostage by another outlaw.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Dale unknowingly buys a stove containing stolen payroll money from a local peddler (Dub Taylor).

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: An attractive milliner and her grandfather are suspects in a plot to rob the Wells Fargo office.

programme.title: Montana Desperado
programme.desc: After the fourth tenant has been murdered on his ranch, Dave Borden is accused of the slayings but cleared. A neighboring rancher is also murdered by a mysterious masked rider, and his daughter Sally Wilson inherits his ranch.

programme.title: Canyon Ambush
programme.desc: A government agent (Johnny Mack Brown) searches for a masked rider and his murderous gang.

programme.title: The Lucky Texan
programme.desc: Jerry Mason (John Wayne) and his friend Jake (George Hayes) have to keep two crooks away from their gold.

programme.title: The Man From Utah
programme.desc: A tough cowboy has a head-to-head confrontation with a gang of outlaws using a rodeo as its base of operations.

programme.title: Harry Tracy
programme.desc: The last survivor (Bruce Dern) of Butch Cassidy's gang turns the century with an artist (Michael C. Gwynne) and a judge's daughter (Helen Shaver).
